title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4227.4 - Instructions to jockeys
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4227.4 - Instructions to jockeys

State Regulations

All horses are expected to give their best efforts in
races in which they run, and any instructions or advice to jockeys to ride or
handle their mounts otherwise than for the purpose of winning are forbidden, and will subject all persons giving or following such instructions or advice to
disciplinary action by the judges and the commission. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4227.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
